trans-unit.source: Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to do real-time sentiment analysis of big data from Twitter using HBase in an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to do real-time sentiment analysis of big data from Twitter using HBase in an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.

trans-unit.source: Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to do real-time [sentiment analysis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentiment_analysis) of big data from Twitter by using HBase in an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to do real-time [sentiment analysis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentiment_analysis) of big data from Twitter by using HBase in an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.

trans-unit.source: Social websites are one of the major driving forces for big data adoption.
trans-unit.target: Social websites are one of the major driving forces for big data adoption.

trans-unit.source: Public APIs provided by sites like Twitter are a useful source of data for analyzing and understanding popular trends.
trans-unit.target: Public APIs provided by sites like Twitter are a useful source of data for analyzing and understanding popular trends.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will develop a console streaming service application and an ASP.NET web application to perform the following:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will develop a console streaming service application and an ASP.NET web application to perform the following:

trans-unit.source: The streaming application
trans-unit.target: The streaming application

trans-unit.source: get geo-tagged tweets in real time by using the Twitter streaming API
trans-unit.target: get geo-tagged tweets in real time by using the Twitter streaming API

trans-unit.source: evaluate the sentiment of these tweets
trans-unit.target: evaluate the sentiment of these tweets

trans-unit.source: store the sentiment information in HBase by using the Microsoft HBase SDK
trans-unit.target: store the sentiment information in HBase by using the Microsoft HBase SDK

trans-unit.source: The Azure Websites application
trans-unit.target: The Azure Websites application

trans-unit.source: plot the real-time statistical results on Bing maps by using an ASP.NET web application.
trans-unit.target: plot the real-time statistical results on Bing maps by using an ASP.NET web application.

trans-unit.source: A visualization of the tweets will look something like this:
trans-unit.target: A visualization of the tweets will look something like this:

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight.hbase.twitter.sentiment.bing.map][img-bing-map]
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight.hbase.twitter.sentiment.bing.map][img-bing-map]

trans-unit.source: You will be able to query tweets with certain keywords to get a sense of if the expressed opinion in the tweets is positive, negative, or neutral.
trans-unit.target: You will be able to query tweets with certain keywords to get a sense of if the expressed opinion in the tweets is positive, negative, or neutral.

trans-unit.source: A complete Visual Studio solution sample can be found on GitHub: [Realtime social sentiment analysis app](https://github.com/maxluk/tweet-sentiment).
trans-unit.target: A complete Visual Studio solution sample can be found on GitHub: [Realtime social sentiment analysis app](https://github.com/maxluk/tweet-sentiment).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An HBase cluster in HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: **An HBase cluster in HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about creating clusters, see [Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight] [hbase-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about creating clusters, see [Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight] [hbase-get-started].

trans-unit.source: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:

trans-unit.source: **A workstation** with Visual Studio 2013 installed.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation** with Visual Studio 2013 installed.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Installing Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Installing Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Create a Twitter application ID and secrets
trans-unit.target: Create a Twitter application ID and secrets

trans-unit.source: The Twitter streaming APIs use [OAuth](http://oauth.net/) to authorize requests.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter streaming APIs use [OAuth](http://oauth.net/) to authorize requests.

trans-unit.source: The first step to use OAuth is to create a new application on the Twitter developer site.
trans-unit.target: The first step to use OAuth is to create a new application on the Twitter developer site.

trans-unit.source: **To create Twitter application ID and secrets**
trans-unit.target: **To create Twitter application ID and secrets**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [Twitter Apps](https://apps.twitter.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [Twitter Apps](https://apps.twitter.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create New App**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create New App**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a **Name**, **Description**, and **Website**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a **Name**, **Description**, and **Website**.

trans-unit.source: The Twitter application name must be an unique name.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter application name must be an unique name.

trans-unit.source: The Website field is not really used.
trans-unit.target: The Website field is not really used.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't have to be a valid URL.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't have to be a valid URL.

trans-unit.source: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.
trans-unit.target: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Permissions** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Permissions** tab.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is **Read only**.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is **Read only**.

trans-unit.source: This is sufficient for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is sufficient for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create my access token**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create my access token**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret** values.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret** values.

trans-unit.source: You will need these values later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need these values later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: ![hdi.hbase.twitter.sentiment.twitter.app][img-twitter-app]
trans-unit.target: ![hdi.hbase.twitter.sentiment.twitter.app][img-twitter-app]

trans-unit.source: Create Twitter streaming service
trans-unit.target: Create Twitter streaming service

trans-unit.source: You need to create an application to get tweets, calculate tweet sentiment score, and send the processed tweet words to HBase.
trans-unit.target: You need to create an application to get tweets, calculate tweet sentiment score, and send the processed tweet words to HBase.

trans-unit.source: **To create the streaming application**
trans-unit.target: **To create the streaming application**

trans-unit.source: Open **Visual Studio**, and create a Visual C# console application called **TweetSentimentStreaming**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Visual Studio**, and create a Visual C# console application called **TweetSentimentStreaming**.

trans-unit.source: From **Package Manager Console**, run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: From **Package Manager Console**, run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: These commands install the [HBase .NET SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.HBase.Client/) package, which is the client library to access the HBase cluster, and the [Tweetinvi API](https://www.nuget.org/packages/TweetinviAPI/) package, which is used to access the Twitter API.
trans-unit.target: These commands install the [HBase .NET SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.HBase.Client/) package, which is the client library to access the HBase cluster, and the [Tweetinvi API](https://www.nuget.org/packages/TweetinviAPI/) package, which is used to access the Twitter API.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, add **System.Configuration" to the reference.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, add **System.Configuration" to the reference.

trans-unit.source: Add a new class file to the project called **HBaseWriter.cs**, and then replace the code with the following:
trans-unit.target: Add a new class file to the project called **HBaseWriter.cs**, and then replace the code with the following:

trans-unit.source: Set the constants in the previous code, including **CLUSTERNAME**, **HADOOPUSERNAME**, **HADOOPUSERPASSWORD**, and DICTIONARYFILENAME.
trans-unit.target: Set the constants in the previous code, including **CLUSTERNAME**, **HADOOPUSERNAME**, **HADOOPUSERPASSWORD**, and DICTIONARYFILENAME.

trans-unit.source: The DICTIONARYFILENAME is the filename and the location of the direction.tsv.
trans-unit.target: The DICTIONARYFILENAME is the filename and the location of the direction.tsv.

trans-unit.source: The file can be downloaded from **https://hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/twittersentiment/dictionary.tsv**.
trans-unit.target: The file can be downloaded from **https://hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/twittersentiment/dictionary.tsv**.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the HBase table name, you must change the table name in the web application accordingly.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the HBase table name, you must change the table name in the web application accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Open **Program.cs**, and replace the code with the following:
trans-unit.target: Open **Program.cs**, and replace the code with the following:

trans-unit.source: Set the constants including **TWITTERAPPACCESSTOKEN**, **TWITTERAPPACCESSTOKENSECRET**, **TWITTERAPPAPIKEY** and **TWITTERAPPAPISECRET**.
trans-unit.target: Set the constants including **TWITTERAPPACCESSTOKEN**, **TWITTERAPPACCESSTOKENSECRET**, **TWITTERAPPAPIKEY** and **TWITTERAPPAPISECRET**.

trans-unit.source: To run the streaming service, press **F5**.
trans-unit.target: To run the streaming service, press **F5**.

trans-unit.source: The following is a screenshot of the console application:
trans-unit.target: The following is a screenshot of the console application:

trans-unit.source: Keep the streaming console application running while you develop the web application, so you have more data to use.
trans-unit.target: Keep the streaming console application running while you develop the web application, so you have more data to use.

trans-unit.source: To examine the data inserted into the table, you can use HBase Shell.
trans-unit.target: To examine the data inserted into the table, you can use HBase Shell.

trans-unit.source: See [Get started with HBase in HDInsight](hdinsight-hbase-tutorial-get-started.md#create-tables-and-insert-data).
trans-unit.target: See [Get started with HBase in HDInsight](hdinsight-hbase-tutorial-get-started.md#create-tables-and-insert-data).

trans-unit.source: Visualize real-time sentiment
trans-unit.target: Visualize real-time sentiment

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create an ASP.NET MVC web application to read the real-time sentiment data from HBase and plot the data on Bing maps.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create an ASP.NET MVC web application to read the real-time sentiment data from HBase and plot the data on Bing maps.

trans-unit.source: **To create an ASP.NET MVC Web application**
trans-unit.target: **To create an ASP.NET MVC Web application**

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Click **File**, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: Click **File**, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Template category: **Visual C#/Web**
trans-unit.target: Template category: **Visual C#/Web**

trans-unit.source: Template: **ASP.NET Web Application**
trans-unit.target: Template: **ASP.NET Web Application**

trans-unit.source: Name: **TweetSentimentWeb**
trans-unit.target: Name: **TweetSentimentWeb**

trans-unit.source: Location: **C:\Tutorials**
trans-unit.target: Location: **C:\Tutorials**

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In **Select a template**, click **MVC**.
trans-unit.target: In **Select a template**, click **MVC**.

trans-unit.source: In **Microsoft Azure**, click **Manage Subscriptions**.
trans-unit.target: In **Microsoft Azure**, click **Manage Subscriptions**.

trans-unit.source: From **Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions**, click **Sign in**.
trans-unit.target: From **Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions**, click **Sign in**.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure credentials.
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure credentials.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure subscription information will be shown on the **Accounts** tab.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure subscription information will be shown on the **Accounts** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close** to close the **Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions** window.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close** to close the **Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions** window.

trans-unit.source: From **New ASP.NET Project - TweetSentimentWeb**, click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: From **New ASP.NET Project - TweetSentimentWeb**, click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: From **Configure Microsoft Azure Site Settings**, select the **Region** that is closest to you.
trans-unit.target: From **Configure Microsoft Azure Site Settings**, select the **Region** that is closest to you.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to specify a database server.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to specify a database server.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **To install NuGet packages**
trans-unit.target: **To install NuGet packages**

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: The console panel is opened at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: The console panel is opened at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to install the [HBase .NET SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.HBase.Client/) package, which is the client library to access HBase cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to install the [HBase .NET SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.HBase.Client/) package, which is the client library to access HBase cluster:

trans-unit.source: **To add HBaseReader class**
trans-unit.target: **To add HBaseReader class**

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentiment**.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentiment**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Models**, click **Add**, and then click **Class**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Models**, click **Add**, and then click **Class**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** field, type **HBaseReader.cs**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** field, type **HBaseReader.cs**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the code with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the code with the following:

trans-unit.source: Inside the **HBaseReader** class, change the constant values as follows:
trans-unit.target: Inside the **HBaseReader** class, change the constant values as follows:

trans-unit.source: **CLUSTERNAME**: The HBase cluster name, for example, *https://<HBaseClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/*.
trans-unit.target: **CLUSTERNAME**: The HBase cluster name, for example, *https://<HBaseClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/*.

trans-unit.source: **HADOOPUSERNAME**: The HBase cluster Hadoop user user name.
trans-unit.target: **HADOOPUSERNAME**: The HBase cluster Hadoop user user name.

trans-unit.source: The default name is *admin*.
trans-unit.target: The default name is *admin*.

trans-unit.source: **HADOOPUSERPASSWORD**: The HBase cluster Hadoop user password.
trans-unit.target: **HADOOPUSERPASSWORD**: The HBase cluster Hadoop user password.

trans-unit.source: **HBASETABLENAME** = "tweets_by_words";
trans-unit.target: **HBASETABLENAME** = "tweets_by_words";

trans-unit.source: The HBase table name is **"tweets_by_words";**.
trans-unit.target: The HBase table name is **"tweets_by_words";**.

trans-unit.source: The values must match the values you sent in the streaming service, so that the web application reads the data from the same HBase table.
trans-unit.target: The values must match the values you sent in the streaming service, so that the web application reads the data from the same HBase table.

trans-unit.source: **To add TweetsController controller**
trans-unit.target: **To add TweetsController controller**

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentimentWeb**.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentimentWeb**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Controllers**, click **Add**, and then click **Controller**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Controllers**, click **Add**, and then click **Controller**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Web API 2 Controller - Empty**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Web API 2 Controller - Empty**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Controller name** field, type **TweetsController**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Controller name** field, type **TweetsController**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click TweetsController.cs to open the file.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click TweetsController.cs to open the file.

trans-unit.source: Modify the file, so it looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: Modify the file, so it looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: **To add heatmap.js**
trans-unit.target: **To add heatmap.js**

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentimentWeb**.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentimentWeb**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Scripts**, click **Add**, click **JavaScript File**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Scripts**, click **Add**, click **JavaScript File**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Item name** field, type **heatmap.js**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Item name** field, type **heatmap.js**.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following code into the file.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following code into the file.

trans-unit.source: The code was written by Alastair Aitchison.
trans-unit.target: The code was written by Alastair Aitchison.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Bing Maps AJAX v7 HeatMap Library](http://alastaira.wordpress.com/2011/04/15/bing-maps-ajax-v7-heatmap-library/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Bing Maps AJAX v7 HeatMap Library](http://alastaira.wordpress.com/2011/04/15/bing-maps-ajax-v7-heatmap-library/).

trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, expand **TweetSentimentWeb**, and then double-click **Global.asax**.

trans-unit.source: **To run the web application**
trans-unit.target: **To run the web application**

trans-unit.source: Verify that the streaming service console application is still running so you can see the real-time changes.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the streaming service console application is still running so you can see the real-time changes.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the web application:
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the web application:

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight.hbase.twitter.sentiment.bing.map][img-bing-map]
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight.hbase.twitter.sentiment.bing.map][img-bing-map]

trans-unit.source: In the text box, enter a keyword, and then click **Go**.
trans-unit.target: In the text box, enter a keyword, and then click **Go**.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the data collected in the HBase table, some keywords might not be found.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the data collected in the HBase table, some keywords might not be found.

trans-unit.source: Try some common keywords, such as "love," "xbox," and "playstation."
trans-unit.target: Try some common keywords, such as "love," "xbox," and "playstation."

trans-unit.source: Toggle among **Positive**, **Neutral**, and **Negative** to compare sentiment on the subject.
trans-unit.target: Toggle among **Positive**, **Neutral**, and **Negative** to compare sentiment on the subject.

trans-unit.source: Let the streaming service run for another hour, and then search the same keywords, and compare the results.
trans-unit.target: Let the streaming service run for another hour, and then search the same keywords, and compare the results.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can deploy the application to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can deploy the application to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Get started with Azure Websites and ASP.NET][website-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Get started with Azure Websites and ASP.NET][website-get-started].

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learned how to get tweets, analyze the sentiment of tweets, save the sentiment data to HBase, and present the real-time Twitter sentiment data to Bing maps.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learned how to get tweets, analyze the sentiment of tweets, save the sentiment data to HBase, and present the real-time Twitter sentiment data to Bing maps.

trans-unit.target: To learn more, see:
